title: Magnavox Odyssey
description: The world's first home video game console. Sold about 330,000 units.

title: Pong
description: Atari releases Pong, one of the first arcade games to gain major commercial success.

title: Breakout
description: Atari releases Breakout, designed with early involvement from Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak.

title: Atari 2600
description: One of the most influential game consoles, popularizing ROM cartridges.

title: Space Invaders
description: A landmark arcade shooter that sparked a global gaming craze.

title: Pac-Man
description: Pac-Man becomes a cultural icon and one of the most successful arcade games ever.

title: Donkey Kong
description: Introduced Mario (then Jumpman) and established Nintendo as a major game developer.

title: Tron Arcade
description: An arcade game inspired by the Tron movie; represents early movieâ€“game crossovers.

title: Famicom / NES
description: Nintendo releases the Famicom in Japan. Later becomes the NES worldwide, reviving the game industry.

title: Tetris
description: One of the most influential puzzle games ever, designed by Alexey Pajitnov.

title: Super Mario Bros.
description: Revolutionizes platformers and becomes one of the best-selling games of all time.

title: The Legend of Zelda
description: Introduces open-world exploration and becomes one of Nintendo's flagship franchises.

title: Street Fighter
description: Capcom releases the first Street Fighter, paving the way for future fighting games.

title: Sega Mega Drive / Genesis
description: Sega's most successful console, known for fast arcade-style gameplay.

title: Game Boy
description: Nintendo releases the Game Boy, defining handheld gaming for decades.

title: Super Famicom / SNES
description: Nintendo releases the SNES with enhanced graphics and iconic first-party titles.

title: Sonic the Hedgehog
description: Sega introduces Sonic, becoming a strong competitor to Nintendo's Mario.

title: Mortal Kombat
description: Known for digitized graphics and violent gameplay; led to the creation of ESRB ratings.

title: DOOM
description: Popularizes the FPS genre and multiplayer deathmatch.

title: PlayStation
description: Sony enters the market and dominates 3D gaming with CD-ROM technology.

title: Nintendo 64
description: Known for Super Mario 64 and Ocarina of Time, setting new 3D gameplay standards.

title: Final Fantasy VII
description: A landmark JRPG that popularized the genre worldwide.

title: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
description: Often considered one of the greatest games ever made.

title: Dreamcast
description: First console with built-in online connectivity; ahead of its time.

title: PlayStation 2
description: The best-selling console in history with over 155 million units sold.

title: Xbox
description: Microsoft enters gaming; Halo becomes a defining FPS franchise.

title: Game Boy Advance
description: Nintendo's 32-bit handheld console with major graphical improvements.

title: Nintendo DS
description: Dual-screen touchscreen device that becomes the best-selling handheld ever.

title: Xbox 360
description: Brings HD gaming and Xbox Live to the mainstream.

title: Nintendo Wii
description: Introduces motion controls and becomes a global phenomenon.
